review: I love my Roku Streaming Stick. We use it in the bedroom and it is a great device.Pros:It plays all the big apps/channels we use (Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, Watch ESPN, HBO Go, and PBS). I got this instead of the Google Chromecast beacuse it has an actual interface on the screen and a remote. I love that you can add just the channels you want and get rid of any you don't use.Cons:Not a huge deal, but it takes a long time to boot up, compared to my other devices (Apple TV, Sony Blu-Ray Player, PS3). But I always just turn on the TV, then go brush my teeth and stuff for bed, then it's ready to go when I get back.Also, it can be easy to accidentally bump one of the buttons at the bottom of the controller (especially in a dark room) and suddenly be taken away from a show you're watching on Hulu to jump to Netflix. Back-lit buttons would help. The Netflix and Amazon Prime shortcut buttons are convenient, but what's up with the Blockbuster button? A Hulu button would have been ideal.Summary:Even though I listed some cons, I still gave the device 5 stars because, ultimately, it allows us to watch all the shows we want in our bedroom without cable or satellite! I highly recommend this to anyone looking to "cut the cord."
author: Josh Bledsoe

review: So far,  this doesn't work quite as well as I had hoped.  The set up was a hassle.  I don't understand why it will not let you plug in a keyboard to your tv for all the signups!  Using the remote to enter your email and passwords for Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc - is a royal pain.Aside from the set up, it seems a bit slow to start up.  This might be my internet/wireless - I do have service coming for that.  I'll update if it fixes after they replace my modem.For anyone, who is like me, and thought they purchased a smart tv but didn't -- this is a handy little tool to plug into your tv so you can watch Netflix & Amazon Prime without having to turn on your PC.  It has other options, I have not tried and doubt I will anytime soon - such as paid tv/movies, and various other paid watching choices.It does what I wanted it to do and simplifies the process of watching / streaming to my tv - so I'm basically satisfied.I think it works better (for me) than Chrome would have - since I don't have an android phone to stream from.
author: Janet

review: Nothing but problems.  Connectivity issues where there should be none.  Password issues where there should be none. Constant resets.  I have a Roku 3 that has been an excellent product.  The streaming stick is crap.
author: CraigT

review: I like this much better than the Chromecast we previously bought.  The device is menu driven and the remote works great.  I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a few movies for free.  Thus far though I wouldn't suggest that the 'newest' movies will be available to you if you buy it.  But still, it works great for the money!
author: M. Dunlap

review: We have another roku so I was excited to hear of the Roku stick.  My advice, save yourself a lot of headache and don't buy.  First to even link it was difficult and I had to watch You Tube videos for the secret screen in settings.  When I finally got it linked it was very slow, meaning I couldn't even pull up movies to try to watch them.  I had very high hopes for this and was very disappointed.  I have returned to Amazon and had to pay shipping for return.
author: Jon Ackman

review: The best thing I can say about this product is that Amazon gave me a full refund without any hassle.  I tried to hook this to my TV but never got it to work.  Roku support was worthless.  After return, I purchased a NetGear device that connected without any problems and works fine.
author: Mark H. Kolman

author: Sascha

review: So far, so good! Compact, you can't even see it! Easy set up, lots of options for streaming apps.
author: Aella W

review: I can't really give this product a fair rating as it didn't work long enough to test it out.  It worked for a month or two (probably only used 4 times) and then it wouldn't start up (freezes immediately at the Roku logo screen).  My mistake for assuming the warranty period would be longer than 90 days.  Now I have wasted $50 and at least an hour of my life with Roku technical support.Pretty sad that a device that just sits there plugged into your tv can die so soon after very minimal use.  I guess I know why the warranty period is only 90 days.  As this is this is the second Roku product that I have had issues with shortly after buying, this will be my last Roku product purchase.
